events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred on the morning of April 30th involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to the nature of the collision and the involvement of the customer's vehicle.
An agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to the case to guide the customer through the settlement process.
The insurance company sent a formal acknowledgment to the customer, ensuring they are informed that their claim is being processed promptly.
Request was made for the customer to submit the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and the accident report from the authorities.
The customer provided all requested documents including a police report and multiple pictures clearly showing the damages sustained in the collision.
An investigation was initiated to assess the circumstances of the collision and to verify the extent of the damage to the insured vehicle.
The investigation concluded that the other driver was at fault and the damages reported are consistent with the collision details provided.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer covering the full repair costs and rental car reimbursement during the repair period.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the prompt handling of the claim and communicated willingness to accept the proposed settlement.
The claim was officially approved following the customer’s acceptance of the settlement terms and confirmation of repair arrangements.
The payment for the approved claim was processed and issued to the repair shop as well as reimbursement to the customer’s rental car agency.
The claim was officially closed after confirmation that all payments were made, and the vehicle repairs were completed to customer satisfaction.
The case file was archived in compliance with company policy to maintain records of all settled auto accident claims for future reference.
